metadata.title: CVE-2013-6339 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
The dissect_openwire_type function in epan/dissectors/packet-openwire.c inthe OpenWire dissector in Wireshark 1.8.x before 1.8.11 and 1.10.x before1.10.3 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (loop) via acrafted packet.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-6339` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 1.10.3-1
libwireshark5 - 1.10.3-1
libwiretap4 - 1.10.3-1
libwsutil4 - 1.10.3-1
tshark - 1.10.3-1
wireshark - 1.10.3-1
wireshark-common - 1.10.3-1
wireshark-qt - 1.10.3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10.3-1').
